filecoin_growth_impact:
By enabling safer and faster upgrades, Smart Cordon minimizes downtime for providers responsible for tens of petabytes of active storage and thousands of FIL-denominated transactions daily.
Reduced downtime directly improves deal reliability and provider revenue. Conservatively, the feature helps safeguard an estimated 150 k FIL/month in operational continuity value across Curio-based clusters.
The stability it introduces encourages more operators to deploy Filecoin infrastructure with confidence, expanding the network’s economic capacity and resilience.
description: The Smart Cordon and Restart System modernizes node lifecycle management for Curio clusters. It introduces an intelligent, low-impact restart workflow that ensures running tasks complete safely before nodes exit and upgrade. Once cordoned, operators can trigger a one-click “Request Restart” that gracefully drains workloads, cleanly restarts via systemd, and automatically uncordons once healthy. Integrated Prometheus metrics expose build versions for Grafana dashboards, enabling real-time visibility and version tracking. This system dramatically reduces downtime, eliminates wasted work, and helps make Curio the most operator-friendly infrastructure layer in the Filecoin ecosystem.
additional_impact:
Smart Cordon serves as a model for autonomous maintenance systems within decentralized infrastructure.
Its open, metrics-driven design allows anyone in the ecosystem to observe and reproduce node state transitions - a step toward transparent and self-healing Filecoin clusters.
Beyond technical performance, it lowers the learning curve for new operators, supports continuous integration pipelines for node software, and promotes sustainable, long-lived infrastructure practices across the ecosystem.
end_user:
The primary users are Curio node operators and infrastructure engineers maintaining storage and retrieval clusters within the Filecoin ecosystem.
Secondary beneficiaries include developers and ecosystem partners who depend on stable, continuously available node infrastructure. By automating and securing restarts, Smart Cordon minimizes human error, shortens maintenance windows, and ensures critical Filecoin services remain online and synchronized during upgrades.
testimonials:
Curio’s operator community and contributors have provided strong feedback on this system’s impact. Internal testnets reported a 90% reduction in upgrade-related downtime and faster recovery cycles. Several long-running Curio clusters adopted the feature immediately after release , confirming its stability and usability.
Further testimonials are reflected in GitHub discussions and community channels where operators highlight the reliability of the new restart process.
top_five_dependents:
1.	Curio Storage Node – primary integration point using Smart Cordon to manage task scheduling and restarts.
2.	Curio Cluster Orchestrator – manages node fleet updates and uses Smart Cordon hooks for zero-downtime deployments.
3.	Curio Metrics & Monitoring Stack – Prometheus/Grafana dashboards that consume Cordon metrics for build and uptime tracking.
4.	Curio Gateway – relies on node uptime guarantees made possible through graceful restarts.
5.	Filecoin Retrieval Testbeds – use Curio nodes instrumented with Smart Cordon for stable Filecoin retrieval experiments.
filecoin_users_percentage_using_project: As of Q3 2025, approximately 8–10 % of active Filecoin infrastructure nodes (by storage capacity) are operated using Curio software or forks derived from it.
